terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
Comprehensive written materials that explain how to use, implement, or understand a product, including user manuals, guides, and technical specifications
A centralized digital platform that organizes and provides access to documentation, guides, and information resources for users
The practice of creating clear, concise documentation that explains complex technical information to specific audiences
A document that provides step-by-step instructions and information on how to use a specific product or software
Technical documentation that explains how to effectively use and integrate with an Application Programming Interface
A professional responsible for overseeing the development, strategy, and lifecycle of a product, including its documentation
Search Engine Optimization - the practice of optimizing content to improve its visibility and ranking in search engine results
The process of making software or documentation available for use, often involving publishing to a live environment
A software component that adds specific features or functionality to an existing application or platform
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code, allowing multiple versions to exist and be managed simultaneously
A process where user responses and comments are collected and used to improve documentation or products iteratively
A pre-designed document structure or format that provides a consistent framework for creating similar types of content
Data that provides information about other data, such as creation dates, author information, or document properties
The process of adapting documentation or software for different languages, cultures, and regional requirements
